intro: Crucianella herbacea, commonly known as the creeping bladderwort, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, oval-shaped leaves that often have a bladders-like appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers with five petals, typically arranged in clusters. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils. Crucianella herbacea is a carnivorous plant, capturing small aquatic insects using specialized bladder-like structures.
